e4: Recommend transitioning to unbiased reporting regardless of short-run effects on valuation, ensuring compliance with financial regulations and increasing investor trust. The company should prioritize transparency while utilizing communications channels with investors regarding the change in policy.
e5: As a reporting policy, it would be viewed as ethical when it accurately and transparently discloses true earnings to investors. Additionally, stakeholders should understand the basis of financial performance reported to avoid confusion while fostering trust among various market participants. Disclosed rationale underlying changes in policy also supports continuity for an ongoing relationship that balances short-term impacts as well as a company's long-run performance objectives.
e6: Request further clarification regarding the implications and expected impacts, both on short-term and long-term performance, of adopting an unbiased reporting policy by the investor community. Also inquire about strategies to ensure transparency around changes in financial disclosure practices that would minimize potential stock market speculation driven solely by earnings bias discrepancies.
